titleStmt.title: John Maris to James F. Robinson
CWG8880

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
June 15th 1863
Bushes Store
Laurel Co, Ky
To, his Exclincy
G. W. Roberson
gov. of Kentucky

sir Thy is a -- find in my offices a gainst Thos Tuttle for striking Harrison cardell the facts are these Cardell -- went in to the field where Tuttle was at wark with & took Tuttles horse from -- him & Tuttle had him arrested & in arresting the said Cardel Tuttle struck him but did not hurt him cardel was Tride & is on bail & he had Tuttle arrested for striking him & the Jury find Tuttle $10, Tuttle is a --
union Man -- & cardel is a -- horse Rogue Tuttle had bin driving the government waggons for six months & come home & boght a a horse to make a crop & cardel under sick so steel it, under- those circumstances he petitions your -- Exlency to Remitt the find a -- gainst the said Thos Tuttle that in my office Tuttle is an orphan boy & is so harm & discret; & hard working & a poor boy & it wood be a deed of charity to Remit the find the a-bove facts are -- True I am yours Respectfully John Maris, J -- P
Should you see proper to Remit the find you can address Thos Tuttle at Bushes store Laurel county, Ky --

W I Crook one of -- the Jury. Dan. Williams
Sias Jackson.
